thread.title: Tokyo Sexwale joins the race to replace Sepp Blatter as FIFA president
thread.title_full: Tokyo Sexwale joins the race to replace Sepp Blatter as FIFA president

title: Tokyo Sexwale joins the race to replace Sepp Blatter as FIFA president
text:
Tokyo Sexwale joins the race to replace Sepp Blatter as FIFA president 25 Oct 2015 02:32:03 
comments 
South African Tokyo Sexwale has joined the race to replace Sepp Blatter as FIFA president. 
Sexwale has yet to confirm his candidacy personally, but an advisor of the 62-year-old has confirmed to Press Association Sport that he will stand. 
It appears he will do so with the full support of the South African Football Association, which retweeted the following message on its official feed on Saturday evening: "National Executive Committee has unanimously endorsed Tokyo Sexwale's FIFA Presidential candidacy." 
Sexwale has a colourful CV, inside and outside football. 
He was imprisoned on Robben Island alongside Nelson Mandela as a political prisoner during apartheid, later serving as a cabinet minister during Mandela's presidency. 
He was part of his country's 2010 World Cup organising committee and within FIFA he has worked as both an anti-racism advisor and chair of the Israel-Palestine monitoring committee. 
Sexwale joins UEFA president Michael Platini, currently under investigation by the FIFA ethics committee, Prince Al bin al-Hussein. Jerome Champagne and David Nakhid in coming forward before Monday's deadline. Related Sport News
